event.title: estimated that the city's population was 84,034 in 2014

data.event: The Census Bureau estimated that the city's population was 84,034 in 2014.

event.title: dates back at least to June 3, 1719

data.event: Trenton dates back at least to June 3, 1719, when mention was made of a constable being appointed for Trenton, while the area was still part of Hunterdon County.

event.title: were recorded for Trenton Township as of March 2, 1720

data.event: Boundaries were recorded for Trenton Township as of March 2, 1720, a courthouse and jail were constructed in Trenton around 1720 and the Freeholders of Hunterdon County met annually in Trenton.
Boundaries were recorded for Trenton Township as of March 2, 1720, a courthouse and jail were constructed in Trenton around 1720 and the Freeholders of Hunterdon County met annually in Trenton.

event.title: became New Jersey's capital as of November 25, 1790

data.event: Trenton became New Jersey's capital as of November 25, 1790, and the City of Trenton was formed within Trenton Township on November 13, 1792.

event.title: was formed within Trenton Township on November 13, 1792

data.event: Trenton became New Jersey's capital as of November 25, 1790, and the City of Trenton was formed within Trenton Township on November 13, 1792.

event.title: was incorporated as one of New Jersey's initial group of 104 townships by an act of the New Jersey Legislature on February 21, 1798

data.event: Trenton Township was incorporated as one of New Jersey's initial group of 104 townships by an act of the New Jersey Legislature on February 21, 1798.

event.title: February 22, 1834, portions of Trenton Township were taken

data.event: On February 22, 1834, portions of Trenton Township were taken to form Ewing Township.

event.title: was absorbed by the City of Trenton on April 10, 1837

data.event: The remaining portion of Trenton Township was absorbed by the City of Trenton on April 10, 1837.

event.title: were annexed to Trenton on March 23, 1900

data.event: Portions of Ewing Township and Hamilton Township were annexed to Trenton on March 23, 1900.
